pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a `leadingCoeff` function on Hahn series. For nonzero Hahn series, it returns the coefficient of the minimum element of support.  For zero, it returns zero.  This function generalizes `x.coeff x.order` to the setting where the exponent type does not have zero.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph

### PR summary [83bfb68fb0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12996/commits/83bfb68fb0e18fcc212bc40c8bd1c59a272780cc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ addOppositeEquiv`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_leadingCoeff`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_orderTop`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_support`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_symm_leadingCoeff`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_symm_orderTop`
`+ addOppositeEquiv_symm_support`
`+ leadingCoeff`
`+ leadingCoeff_add_eq_left`
`+ leadingCoeff_add_eq_right`
`+ leadingCoeff_eq`
`+ leadingCoeff_eq_iff`
`+ leadingCoeff_ne_iff`
`+ leadingCoeff_of_ne`
`+ leadingCoeff_of_single`
`+ leadingCoeff_sub`
`+ leadingCoeff_zero`
`+ lt_orderTop_single`
`+ min_le_min_add`
`+ min_orderTop_le_orderTop_add`
`+ min_orderTop_le_orderTop_sub`
`+ orderTop_add_eq_left`
`+ orderTop_add_eq_right`
`+ orderTop_neg`
`+ orderTop_single_le`
`+ orderTop_sub`
`+ zero_le_orderTop_iff`
`+ zero_lt_orderTop_iff`
`+ zero_lt_orderTop_of_order`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

If you want, you can add
```lean
/--
`addOppositeEquiv` is an additive monoid isomorphism between
Hahn series over `Γ` with coefficients in the opposite additive monoid `Rᵃᵒᵖ`
and the additive opposite of Hahn series over `Γ` with coefficients `R`.
-/
@[simps (config := .lemmasOnly)]
def addOppositeEquiv : HahnSeries Γ (Rᵃᵒᵖ) ≃+ (HahnSeries Γ R)ᵃᵒᵖ where
  toFun x := .op ⟨fun a ↦ (x.coeff a).unop, by convert x.isPWO_support; ext; simp⟩
  invFun x := ⟨fun a ↦ .op (x.unop.coeff a), by convert x.unop.isPWO_support; ext; simp⟩
  left_inv x := by ext; simp
  right_inv x := by
    apply AddOpposite.unop_injective
    ext
    simp
  map_add' x y := by
    apply AddOpposite.unop_injective
    ext
    simp

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_support (x : HahnSeries Γ (Rᵃᵒᵖ)) :
    (addOppositeEquiv x).unop.support = x.support := by
  ext
  simp [addOppositeEquiv_apply]

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_symm_support (x : (HahnSeries Γ R)ᵃᵒᵖ) :
    (addOppositeEquiv.symm x).support = x.unop.support := by
  rw [← addOppositeEquiv_support, AddEquiv.apply_symm_apply]

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_orderTop (x : HahnSeries Γ (Rᵃᵒᵖ)) :
    (addOppositeEquiv x).unop.orderTop = x.orderTop := by
  simp only [orderTop, AddOpposite.unop_op, mk_eq_zero, AddEquivClass.map_eq_zero_iff,
    addOppositeEquiv_support, ne_eq]
  simp only [addOppositeEquiv_apply, AddOpposite.unop_op, mk_eq_zero, zero_coeff]
  simp_rw [HahnSeries.ext_iff x 0, Function.funext_iff]
  simp only [Pi.zero_apply, AddOpposite.unop_eq_zero_iff, zero_coeff]

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_symm_orderTop (x : (HahnSeries Γ R)ᵃᵒᵖ) :
    (addOppositeEquiv.symm x).orderTop = x.unop.orderTop := by
  rw [← addOppositeEquiv_orderTop, AddEquiv.apply_symm_apply]

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_leadingCoeff (x : HahnSeries Γ (Rᵃᵒᵖ)) :
    (addOppositeEquiv x).unop.leadingCoeff = x.leadingCoeff.unop := by
  simp only [leadingCoeff, AddOpposite.unop_op, mk_eq_zero, AddEquivClass.map_eq_zero_iff,
    addOppositeEquiv_support, ne_eq]
  simp only [addOppositeEquiv_apply, AddOpposite.unop_op, mk_eq_zero, zero_coeff]
  simp_rw [HahnSeries.ext_iff x 0, Function.funext_iff]
  simp only [Pi.zero_apply, AddOpposite.unop_eq_zero_iff, zero_coeff]
  split <;> rfl

@[simp]
lemma addOppositeEquiv_symm_leadingCoeff (x : (HahnSeries Γ R)ᵃᵒᵖ) :
    (addOppositeEquiv.symm x).leadingCoeff = .op x.unop.leadingCoeff := by
  apply AddOpposite.unop_injective
  rw [← addOppositeEquiv_leadingCoeff, AddEquiv.apply_symm_apply, AddOpposite.unop_op]
```
just after the definition of addition.

Then you can golf
```lean
theorem orderTop_add_eq_right {Γ} [LinearOrder Γ] {x y : HahnSeries Γ R}
    (hxy : y.orderTop < x.orderTop) : (x + y).orderTop = y.orderTop := by
  simpa [← map_add, ← AddOpposite.op_add, hxy] using orderTop_add_eq_left
    (x := addOppositeEquiv.symm (.op y))
    (y := addOppositeEquiv.symm (.op x))

-- [snip]

theorem leadingCoeff_add_eq_right {Γ} [LinearOrder Γ] {x y : HahnSeries Γ R}
    (hxy : y.orderTop < x.orderTop) : (x + y).leadingCoeff = y.leadingCoeff := by
  simpa [← map_add, ← AddOpposite.op_add, hxy] using leadingCoeff_add_eq_left
    (x := addOppositeEquiv.symm (.op y))
    (y := addOppositeEquiv.symm (.op x))
```

LGTM, I'll leave it up to you whether you implement the suggestion above.

bors d+

:v: ScottCarnahan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thank you for the reviews!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9813250659/job/27098869495)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9813250659/job/27098869949)
Thanks!
Thanks!

```suggestion
theorem min_le_min_add {Γ} [LinearOrder Γ] {x y : HahnSeries Γ R} (hx : x ≠ 0) (hy : y ≠ 0)
```
maybe protected too as its quite a specialised lemma with a generic sounding name

```suggestion
  rw [← Set.IsWF.min_union]
```

```suggestion
  simp only [orderTop, support_neg, neg_eq_zero]
```

```suggestion
theorem zero_lt_orderTop_iff {x : HahnSeries Γ R} (hx : x ≠ 0) :
```

Please check if you can remove the `@`:
```suggestion
  rw [orderTop_of_ne hx, orderTop_of_ne hy, orderTop_of_ne hxy, ← WithTop.coe_min,
```

```suggestion
  have hx : x ≠ 0 := ne_zero_iff_orderTop.mpr hxy.ne_top
```

```suggestion
  have hcxyne : (x + y).coeff g ≠ 0 := by
```
Would it be worth having `_left` and `_right` variants, one with `x` and one with `y` on the right hand side? Also for the next theorem.
I have added the variants.  Unfortunately, I was not able to avoid basically duplicating the proofs, since addition is not commutative here.

```suggestion
  have hx : x ≠ 0 := ne_zero_iff_orderTop.mpr hxy.ne_top 
```
I might define `leadingCoeff_eq_iff` first and then prove this theorem as `leadingCoeff_eq_iff.not`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (RingTheory/HahnSeries) : def leadingCoeff, orderTop lemmas

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (RingTheory/HahnSeries/Multiplication): module structure on HahnModule
